abstract: I.B.M.’s planned $1.7 billion acquisition of Netezza could spur further bids in the data storage and analytics business.
snippet: I.B.M.’s planned $1.7 billion acquisition of Netezza could spur further bids in the data storage and analytics business.
lead_paragraph: I.B.M.’s planned $1.7 billion acquisition of Netezza could spur further bids in the data storage and analytics business. Heavyweights like Hewlett-Packard, Oracle, Microsoft and Dell, as well as I.B.M., are positioning themselves to lead the way in this critical area of information technology. But the field is shrinking as the best properties get snapped up, and this could lead to a fierce competition for the companies that are left.

headline.main: I.B.M. May Face Rival in Bid for Netezza
